resources.string: Google Account, Xiaomi Account, and Contacts data
Back up Google Account, Xiaomi Account, and other user data
Mi PC Suite is requesting permission to create a backup on a computer. Allow?
Mi PC Suite is requesting permission to restore items on your phone. Allow?
Backing up items using Mi PC Suite… Wait until the backup is complete and try again.
Restoring items using Mi PC Suite… Wait until the items are restored and try again.
"Can't use Mi PC Suite now. Complete backing up or restoring items on your phone and try again."
"Can't use Mi PC Suite in Second space. Switch to First space."
Back up items using Mi PC Suite?

This feature allows you to back up and restore items using your mobile device and computer. This feature needs to connect to the internet and requires the following mandatory permissions to be able to work normally:
" Back up your data, settings, and apps"
" Back up your data, settings, and apps"

"Your backups won't be encrypted, which means that they might be accessed or tempered with by third party apps. Other security risks might also arise. Make sure you store backed up items in a well protected environment."
Some apps may not be able to be backed up or restored.

"This feature allows you to back up items using a USB cable when your device's screen is damaged or doesn't respond. To be able to back up items when the screen isn't responding, you should turn this feature on when the screen still works properly."
Turn off backups with damaged screen
Turn on backups with damaged screen
Ask any person from your contacts to send you an SMS message in the following format replacing the letters with your screen lock: *#*#SCREENLOCK#*#*.
Once the message is sent, connect this device to a computer via USB to start backing up items.

"%1$d. If your screen lock is %2$d, the message should look like this: *#*#%3$d#*#*. If you're using a password that contains both letters and digits, ask the other person to include it in the message without omissions."

"%1$d. If you're using a pattern, it can be represented by digits in the message. The dot in the upper left corner is %2$d. The numbering goes from left to right, line after line, and ends with %3$d in the lower right corner."
"%1$d. If you aren't using a screen lock, use \"nopassword\" instead of the characters that represent it in the message."
"%1$d. You'll have only %2$d attempts to activate this feature. Make sure the SMS message the other person is sending is correct, and the person is in your contacts to succeed."
%1$d. We recommend that you use this feature in the presence of our customer support personnel.
"%1$d. If you can't back up items to your computer, you can learn how to solve this issue in our help documentation."
Turn off backups with damaged screen now?
Turn on backups with damaged screen now?

"Note: After creating a new security question and confirming your date of birth, your Apple ID two-factor authentication will be turned off. If you don't see the option to turn off two-factor authentication on the Apple ID account page, you can't turn it off."
1. Open any web browser on any computer and go to appleid.apple.com.
2. Sign in to the Apple ID you want to disable two factor authentication for, go to the \"Security\" section of account settings and choose \"Edit\".
3. Click \"Turn Off Two-Factor Authentication\". Click again to confirm.
Follow these steps to turn off two-factor authentication for Apple ID:
Turn off Apple ID two-factor authentication
To access your backups, sign in now
Sign in to your Xiaomi Account
To restore user data for %s, touch Restore
"Leaving the app now will interrupt the ongoing transfer. You'll have to establish connection between the two devices again. Leave the app anyway?"
"Couldn't connect to the network. Connect to Wi-Fi to import items from iCloud."
"There's not enough storage space on your device."
A new version of Mi Mover is available. Update Mi Mover now?
"Can't back up items automatically when backup password is on. Turn off backup password first."
"Can't back up items when backup password is on. Turn off backup password."
"Can't use Mi Mover when backup password is on. Turn off backup password first."
"You won't be able to transfer password-protected backups. Turn off backup password before using Mi Mover."
"Can't restore items when backup password is on. Turn off backup password first."

"After you turn this feature off, all local backups will be deleted. Backup settings will be cleared and items will no longer be backed up automatically. You'll still be able to use your device as usual. Turn off anyway?"
Sign in with your Xiaomi Account to access encrypted backups.
"Your backups will be encrypted automatically. You'll need to sign in to your Xiaomi Account to access them."
Turn this feature on to be able to save backups on this device and copy them to your computer or USB storage device. Turn on now?
Turn this feature on to be able to save backups on this device and copy them to your computer. Turn on now?
Incompatible app version. Install this app separately.
"Check your router's connection and try again."
"This app doesn't have the permissions required for it to access Calendar. Go to Settings and check permissions to continue."
All files on SD card (including photos, songs, videos, app data, etc.)
"Back up apps to a USB drive. Make sure the USB drive has enough storage space before you start."
"Searching for the USB backup… Don't change or rename backup files."
Grant all the mandatory permissions to be able to back up and restore items.
"Can't use Mi Mover in Guest mode."
Your Apple ID uses two-factor authentication. Enter verification code.
"Couldn't send verification code. Wait a minute or two and try again."

"1. If you can't receive the verification code, make sure that you've already signed in to iCloud on your Apple device.r 2. If entering the verification code doesn't help, turn off two-factor authentication. "
How to turn off two-factor authentication
"1. A message with the verification code has been sent to %s associated with your Apple ID.r 2. Turn off two-factor authentication if the verification code doesn't work."
Two-factor authentication failed. You can retry or turn off two-factor authentication.
Tap \"Allow\" on your Apple device to make the verification code appear. Enter the verification code here.
Sign in to the iCloud account of your old iOS device
"1. Open Settings on your iOS device, and select iCloud.r 2. Toggle the switches for contacts and other items.r 3. Select Photos and toggle the switch for iCloud Photo Library."
To import data from iOS, you must create an iCloud backup.
"To import data from iOS,r you should create an iCloud backup first."
"You aren't connected to Wi-Fi now. To import data from iCloud, connect to Wi-Fi."
If you already have a backup, touch Next.
Use Mi Talk to back up your contacts across devices.
Due to compatibility issues, you can only transfer partial data from iOS devices. Make sure you create an iCloud backup before starting the transfer.
Mi Mover needs the following permissions: %s.

"Note: 1. To avoid data loss, copy local backups to your computer. 2. Always copy local backups to your computer before performing a factory reset; otherwise, local backups will be lost. 3. Where are local backups stored? %1$s"
System settings, accounts, and app data
Encrypt the items you back up using your Xiaomi Account
Switch to clock mode for the time input.
Switch to text input mode for the time input.
Use your Xiaomi Account to sign in to Xiaomi Cloud, MIUI Themes, and other Mi services, from anywhere.
Tap to switch to selecting a day
Tap to switch to selecting a year
"Can't use Backup in Multi-user mode. Turn off Multi-user mode to continue."
"Can't use Mi Mover in Multi-user mode. Turn off Multi-user mode to continue."
"MIUI associates encrypted backups with your Xiaomi Account. You'll have to sign in to your Xiaomi Account to restore items from such backups."
"Note: %1$d. Copy backups to your computer to avoid data loss. %2$s. %3$d. Backups will be saved to MIUI-Backup-AllBackup."
"Note: %1$d. Copy backups to your computer to avoid data loss. %2$s. %3$d. Backups will be saved to MIUI-Backup-AllBackup. %4$d. Some apps might not support backups."
%d. Wait until all items are backed up.
%d. Copy the file to your computer.
Connect your mobile device to the computer via a USB cable.
Connect your mobile device to the computer via a USB cable.
Note: you can also copy photos and videos from DCIM.
%d. Connect your mobile device to the computer via a USB cable.
%d. Connect your mobile device to the computer via a USB cable.
%d. Copy the backup from your computer to MIUI-Backup-AllBackup.
%d. Copy the backup from your computer to MIUI-Backup-AllBackup.
%1$d. Open \"%2$s\" and select items to restore.
Third party apps and app data
"Note: %1$d. This method allows backing up third party apps and app data. %2$d. Make sure there's enough storage space on your USB drive to store backups."
Only %s of storage is available on your USB drive. Free up storage space.
"Couldn't save items to external storage device. Try connecting it again."
Insufficient storage space. Free up some space and try again.
Not connected to Mi PC Suite
Signing in to iCloud on the old iOS device…
Mi PC Suite is trying to connect to your device
"Couldn't sync the list of backed up items."
You can cancel current task if needed.
You can also generate a QR code on your new device and scan it using the old one.
Read and write on external storage
To be able to back up calendar events, allow this app to edit your calendar events first.
To be able to back up call history, allow this app to access your call history first.
To be able to back up contacts, allow this app to access your contacts first.
To be able to back up messages, allow this app to access your messages first.
This feature allows you to back up and restore items using your mobile device, computers, and USB drives.
This feature allows you to back up and restore items using your mobile device, computers, and USB drives.
Access the list of apps installed on this device
Access and save items to storage
To be able to back up items, allow this feature to access storage first.
To be able to back up and restore messages, contacts, and call history, allow this feature to access these items first.
Allow this feature to access your messages and contacts to be able to back up and restore these items.
Allow this feature to access your contacts to be able to back up and restore these items.
To be able to restore calendar events, allow this app to edit your calendar events first.
To be able to restore call history, allow this app to edit your call history first.
To be able to restore contacts, allow this app to edit your contacts first.
For displaying the apps that can be backed up
To be able to view the apps that can be backed up, allow this app to access the list of apps installed on this device first.

string.name: privacy_policy_link
string.Data: "To learn more about our data processing practices and your rights as a user, read and agree to our Privacy Policy before you continue."

resources.string: Tap the button below to try again.
You may need to sign in again to view restored data.
Restoring will restart the Phone app.
"You won't be able to back up or restore items without all the mandatory permissions. Withdraw permissions anyway?"
"Transfer was interrupted.r The data which wasn't imported must be imported again."
"Importing data from iCloud…r Don't turn off Wi-Fi"
"Not enough storage space.r Free up at least %s."
Check your connection and try again.
You need to add an email address to your Xiaomi Account first.
"There's not enough storage space on your SD card."
Sign in to your Xiaomi Account.
"Couldn't restore. Make sure this backup was made using your Xiaomi Account."
System settings and Home screen layout
Stopping now may result in data loss.
Backup is in progress. Touch OK to view.
This task is already running in the background
Backup and restore are in progress. Touch OK to view.
This process is already running in the background
Restore is in progress. Touch OK to view.
This task is already running in the background
Fifth day of Chinese New Year
Fourth day of Chinese New Year
Second day of Chinese New Year
Seventh day of Chinese New Year
Sixth day of Chinese New Year
Third day of Chinese New Year
If you exit Mi Mover, the ongoing transfer will be interrupted. Wait until the transfer is complete.
"Device isn't compatible. Cancel the transfer and try again."
"Couldn't connect, try again or reboot device. On the other device, go to Settings > Additional Settings > Mi Mover, tap [I'm a sender], or launch Mi Mover again after reboot."
You can restore these from the app, no need to transfer.
System data (including messages, contacts, and call history)
WeChat and QQ data (including chat history)
Looks like the item is too big to transfer.

"1. You can select individual apps you want to transfer. 2. If you select app data, corresponding apps will be selected as well. 3. WeChat and QQ app data might not be transferred due to compatibility issues. You can try in-app transfer features."
The more items you select the longer the transfer will last.
Select WeChat, QQ, and app data
Connection was interrupted. Connect again to continue.
Remote device disconnected. Connect again manually or cancel the transfer.
"Couldn't generate QR code. Close other apps and try again."
Install Mi Mover on your old phone
"Scan this QR code with your old phone to download and install Mi Mover."
Scan the QR code with your old phone to download and install \"Mi Mover\".
After the installation is complete, tap \"Start\" below.
"On a Mi phone, connect to Wi-Fi and tap \"I'm a recipient\". Select your iOS device, sign in to iCloud, and import data."
Tap \"Connect via QR code\" on the new device and scan the QR code to establish connection.
Cancel the transfer, exit Mi Mover, and start over. Duplicate files will be overwritten during the new transfer.

"Mi Mover uses Wi-Fi to transfer files. That's why you can't connect to the internet using Wi-Fi on either device during a transfer. You can still use mobile data, though. However, some newer devices (for example, Mi 6) would still be able to connect to the internet using Wi-Fi during transfers."
"Mi Mover uses Wi-Fi to transfer files. That's why you can't connect to the internet using Wi-Fi on either device during a transfer. You can still use mobile data, though."
Storage space on old devices is used for creating transfer packages. Make sure you have at least 500MB - 1GB of available storage on your old phone before you start a transfer.
There are several reasons why that may happen: system and app version compatibility issues, network problems, compatibility issues specific to a particular device, etc.
Some app profiles (e-banking, finance, etc.) are associated with specific device due to security reasons. Try clearing the app data or re-installing the app on a new device.
"WeChat app data and chat history might not be fully transferred using Mi Mover. Go to WeChat's settings and sign out of your account to get more chances for a successful transfer."
Go to Home screen > Tools > Feedback.
1. Share your feedback using the \"Feedback\" app.
You have to sign in again to your accounts (e.g., Xiaomi Account, Exchange, Google, etc.) on a new device due to security reasons.
"Due to high probability of unsuccessful transfers caused by compatibility issues, Mi Mover doesn't support transferring the data generated by Google apps."
"Mi Mover doesn't transfer Dual apps data to avoid conflicts between files."
"Mi Mover can't access items in Second space. Move items to First space and launch Mi Mover there."
"Tap \"I'm a recipient\". A QR code will be generated."
"Tap \"I'm a sender\". Scan the QR code on the new phone, wait until Mi Mover figures out which files to send, and tap \"Send\"."
Tap \"Start\". Scan the QR code on the new phone, wait until Mi Mover figures out which files to send, and tap \"Send\".
"Mi Mover can't access photos in the hidden album because they are encrypted. You can restore these photos from Xiaomi Cloud on a new device."
%d. How do I use Mi Mover to move data from an iOS device?
"%d. Can't find the hotspot on the old device?"
%d. How do I use Mi Mover to move data from an Android device?
%d. What should I do if Mi Mover got stuck on a certain step?
"%d. Why can't I use Wi-Fi during transfers?"
"%d. Why does Mi Mover tell me there isn't enough storage space on my old phone?"
"%d. Why aren't some apps transferred successfully?"
"%d. Why won't some apps start on a new device?"
"%d. Why isn't WeChat history fully transferred?"
Move contacts, call history, messages, home screen layout, apps, settings, etc. to a new device
"There isn't enough storage space on the old device (%s available). Free up storage space or transfer only important items."

"Mi Mover needs some storage space to package the transferred data, but it looks like there isn't enough space available on the old device. Free up space in \"Security\" or transfer only important items."
Reboot your device or check whether Mi Mover is allowed to use Camera.
Turn on location services to get the list of available Wi-Fi networks.
"Go to Settings > Additional Settings > Mi Mover Tap [I'm a recipient] to create a QR code"
"1. Install Mi Mover app on your old device 2. Open the app and tap Start 3. Scan the QR code with your old device"
"Go to Settings > Additional Settings > Mi Mover, Tap [I'm a sender]"
"Wait until the new phone shows \"Connection was interrupted\". Then tap \"Connect again\" to create a QR code."
"Wait until the old phone shows \"Connection was interrupted\". Then tap \"Connect again\" to scan the QR code."
Open Mi Mover on your old phone, tap \"Start\" and scan the QR code above.
"%s remaining. Don't turn off Wi-Fi Hotspot. Keep devices close to each other."
Scan QR code using new device
"There isn't enough storage space on the new device (%s available). Free up storage space or transfer only important items."
"Select items to transfer. Similar items on the new device will be overwritten. (The size of the transferred items you see now is a rough estimate.)"
"You selected too many items to transfer. Select only important items to make the transfer faster."
Select one device to receive data.
Select one device to transfer data.
"Make sure the old device is on Waiting for the old device to connect…"
"%s remaining. Don't turn off Wi-Fi. Keep devices close to each other."
Scan QR code using old device
"Couldn't start transfer, try again or reboot device."
"You're ready to rock! Tell us what you think about Mi Mover."
"Your new device feels like home now. Did you like Mi Mover?"
"Connected to the old device. Waiting for the transfer…"
"Make sure the old device is on and Mi Mover is on"
Waiting for the old device to connect…
"Don't turn off Wi-fi or switch to other Wi-Fi networks during the transfer. Otherwise, Mi Mover won't be able to transfer data."
"Selected files are big. Make sure the USB drive has enough storage space. Transfer only important items."
"Backup files are big. It might take a while to restore them. Restoring only important items will be faster."
"Only %s is available on your device. Free up space or make multiple smaller transfers."

"Additional storage is required to package your backups. There's not enough storage space to continue the transfer. You can free up space and delete unnecessary files in Security or try tranfering only important items."
"Only %s is available on your USB drive. Free up space or transfer only important items."
Some features require internet connection to work normally.
"Open Mi Mover on the old device, tap \"I'm a sender\" and select a hotspot to connect. Don't close the page before connection is established."
